User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110421 Firefox/6.0a1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110421 Firefox/6.0a1

I opened site: 
http://wbe04.mibbit.com/?server=irc.mozilla.org&channel=%23testday 
in the tab and pinned the tab as app tab.

It's the site for chatting.

Whenever, I place the cursor in the white space provided for typing the text and switch to another tab, 
the app tab always glows blue though there was not any activity going on by any member or by server.

And when I place the cursor in the area where typed messages of different persons appear, and then switch to another tab, the app tab greys out.

I contacted with the moderator 1300-1700: geo there in the chat and he didn't find the same behaviour.  He was getting the greyed out tab which I was not getting.

Therefore, as suggested I have filed the bug.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open site http://wbe04.mibbit.com/?server=irc.mozilla.org&channel=%23testday 
2.Pin that tab as app tab
3.Place cursor in place provided for typing text
4.Switch to another tab

Actual Results:  
The app tab always remained glown blue inspite of fact that there was no activity.

Expected Results:  
The app tab should grey out unless some activity takes place.

comments.raw_text: Mibbit changes the title from "Mibbit" to "[ Mibbit ]" whenever the page loses focus, which triggers the glow.
comments.creator: dao+bmo@mozilla.com
comments.text: Mibbit changes the title from "Mibbit" to "[ Mibbit ]" whenever the page loses focus, which triggers the glow.
comments.author: dao+bmo@mozilla.com

comments.text: Dao's right, as usual. I'd call this invalid  and talk with the Mibbit folks... Unless we're seeing this kind of thing with other sites, in which case we could look at adding some simple title filtering to make the pinned-tab glow more robust to such changes.
